timeline.message:
Issue 13576: Initial drop for JWE generation

For issue #13576

First drop of support JWE creation. Building via server configuration should be working. Incomplete server config coupled with using the `encryptWith()` API method still has some holes.
First delivery of JWE Builder FAT
First delivery of JWE Builder FAT
First delivery of JWE Builder FAT
First delivery of JWE Builder FAT
First delivery of JWE Builder FAT
Update consumer servers for updated tooling

timeline.bodyText: My experience with the consumer side has suggested that specifying these constraints might not be needed; Jose4j might be detecting and pulling this info from the JWE automatically. Perfectly fine if it's working, but might not be necessary.
timeline.author: ayoho

replies.bodyText: I want to fail if the content of the JWE is not what the test expects (which is what we're passing in).  I want to decrypt this thing as the test expects in otherwords...
replies.author: c00crane

timeline.bodyText: Not a problem, but curious why you use SimplePEMEncoder here and then Base64 to do the decoding in getPublicKeyFromPem()?
timeline.author: ayoho

replies.bodyText: Just code done at 2 very different times in different places (and then moved to 1 file).  I'll look at that for the next delivery
replies.author: c00crane

timeline.bodyText: So these aren't ready to be replaced yet?
timeline.author: ayoho

replies.bodyText: no - I'll mess with reworking the mp.jwt tools when I work on the mp.jwt tests.  I want to redo a few things and that'll take more time than I want to spend right now when I'm trying to get the builder finished.
replies.author: c00crane

replies.bodyText:
Coming with the next delivery - the code I had to work from (before last Friday) didn't have the defaults coded for ContentEncryptionAlg and KeyMgmtKeyAlg.
RSA-OAEP-256 is not supported in the config and we'll get the default value now.
replies.author: c00crane
